alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Obion; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 8:53AM CDT until August 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Carroll, Gibson, Obion and Weakley. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 6 and 11 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Martin, Union City, Trenton, Dyer, Greenfield, Troy, Kenton, Rutherford, Bradford, Sharon, Trezevant, Woodland Mills, Rives, Sidonia, Kimery, Mount Pelia, Good Luck, Gardner, Barrons Corner and Tyson Store. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
